resources.string: Shizuku cannot be launched from system_server
This feature is only available when running within system_server
This feature is only available when running as system user
This feature is only available on Samsung devices
This will uninstall DroppedAPK and remove the invalid past signatures from the system package manager. Continue?
Execute arbitrary shell command and show stdout/stderr
Inspect current process using Java reflection
libshizuku.so not found or incorrect file permission. Is the Shizuku-SystemUID fork installed?
Start/stop a virtual Samsung DEX display
Running on display id %1$d. Connect using scrcpy via ADB
Failed to start/stop internal DEX screen: %1$s (%2$s)
Start this app in a different process
List and modify package debug/run-as states
Bypass Play Integrity checks that detects sideloaded apps
This operation will set the install source of %1$s from %2$s to the Play Store. This helps to circumvent Play Integrity checks for side-loaded apps. Proceed?
Enable user switcher in the status bar (requires reboot)
Allows installing self-signed packages in shared system UID groups

This operation will inject custom signing keys for a shared user id. Use the keystore provided in the GitHub repo to sign your app. The password for it is \'abxdroppedapk\'.\n\nWarning: This operation will intentionally freeze and crash the system! Be patient.
Enables DocumentsProvider that exposes files using this process\' permissions
Backup/restore private app data of run-as/debuggable apps
Shizuku permission not granted. Try again after granting

Shizuku is not active or running with the incorrect execution context. This feature needs the Shizuku daemon to be launched via ADB or Wireless ADB due to SELinux restrictions. You cannot use this app\'s Shizuku starter for this. If this keeps happening, reboot your phone. It usually happens after installing updates to this app. Do you want to open Shizuku now?

Shizuku is not active or running with the incorrect execution context. This feature needs the Shizuku daemon to be launched via ADB or Wireless ADB due to SELinux restrictions. You cannot use this app\'s Shizuku starter for this. Do you want to open Shizuku now?
